summary: This document is a set of financial records from the Federal Bureau of Prisons, specifically the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, related to utility payments. It includes a memorandum authorizing a modification to a purchase order for water services from the Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation, an invoice for water charges, a tenant notice about online payments, and an electricity bill. The documents show routine administrative and financial transactions for the MCC facility.

events.title: Purchase Order Modification for Water
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons' MCC New York issues a memorandum to modify a purchase order with the Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation, increasing the amount by $627.2 for underestimated quarterly water charges.

locations: MCC New York, New York, NY 10007
Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation, Brooklyn, NY 11205
Metropolitan Correctional Center, FCI Fort Dix, Fort Dix, NJ 08640-0000
keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held, conducted routine financial transactions for utilities in August 2019.
A purchase order for water services from the Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation was modified, increasing from $600 to $1,227.2 due to underestimated quarterly charges.
An electricity bill from Bay City Metering Co., Inc. shows service for the MCC at 10225 Brooklyn, NY 11205 for the period June to July 2019.
The Brooklyn Navy Yard Development Corporation introduced an online payment system (ClickPay) for tenants, indicating standard property management operations.
These documents are administrative financial records and do not contain any direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or associated individuals.
